data.title: William Henry Hughes (1864-aft.1921)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Harry Hughes born 1864 Walsall, Staffordshire, England, United Kingdom died 1921 Sheffield, Yorkshire, England, United Kingdom including ancestors + descendants + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[sibling(s) unknown]

Descendants

This page has been accessed 181 times.

Biography

William Henry Hughes is the manager's Ahnentafel 6.

William Henry married 1. Emma Holliday, 2. Ellen Webster formerly Holliday. Harry Hughes was a cabinet maker and member of the RAOB. He built a pedestal for his lodge.

William Henry's birth at Pleck Road, Walsall was registered from the same address on April 27 1864 by his mother Elizabeth formerly Cotterill. His father George was a puddler.

In 1871 George Hughes 37, a pudler born Bilston, Staffs, Elizabeth 25 born West Bromwich, Staffs and William Henry 7 born Walsall, Staffs are at Clun Street, Brightside Bierlow, Sheffield.

In 1881 William Henry Hughes 18, a cabinet maker is at 19 Fleet Street, Brightside Bierlow with his parents George 48 and Elizabeth Hughes 36 formerly Cotterell. George and Elizabeth were born in Lincolnshire, William Henry in Walsall, Staffs. George is a furnace man. They have a lodger Albine Williamson 19, a moulder from Nottinghamshire.

Violet Emma, daughter of William Henry, journeyman cabinet maker and Emma hughes formerly Holliday was born at 60 Tipton Street, Brightside. Emma registered the birth on October 16th 1888. She was buried in Tinsley Park Cemetery, Sheffield.

In 1891 William Henry 27 born Walsall, Staffs and Emma 23 born Norwich are at 72 Steadfast Street, Attercliffe cum Darnall with their children George Henry 5, Clara Elizabeth 4 and Blanche May 2 months. William Henry is a cabinet Maker.

In 1901 William Henry 37 and Emma 33 are at 31 Cemetery Road, Ecclesall Bierlow with their children George Henry 15, Clara Elizabeth 14 and Ethel Ellen 8. William Henry and George Henry are cabinet makers, Clara elizabeth is an errand girl. All the children were born in Sheffield.

Harry, son of William Henry, cabinet maker journeyman and Emma Hughes was born on December 8th 1893 at 58 Steadfast Street, Attercliffe. Emma formerly Holliday registered the birth on January 10th 1894.

At the time of Emma's death in July 1906 William Henry and Emma's address was 19 Cemetery Road.

When William Henry registered his father's death in June 1909 his address was 94 Andover Street, Sheffield.

In 1911 William Hy 47 and Ellen Hughes 41 are at 21 Brackley Street with William Hy's daughters Ethel 18, Dorothy Emma 3 and Violet Hughes 9 months and stepchildren George William 19, Walter Edward 17, Alfred 15, Leonard 13, Jessie 11 and Nellie Webster 6. William Henry is a tool chest maker, edge tool man working on his own account, Ethel is a warehouse girl for a firm of cutlers, George William is an electrician in a steel works, Walter Edward is a moulders core maker in a steel works, Alfred is a warehouse boy in a steel works, Leonard is an errand boy for a cardboard box manufacturer. William Henry was born in Walsall, Staffs, Ellen in Carbrooke, Norfolk and the rest in Sheffield. William Hy and Ellen have been married 4 years and have had 2 children.

In 1921 William Henry and Ellen Hughes are in Sheffield with Violet and five others.

Sources

Birth certificate.

Marriage certificate. Birth certificates for George Henry Hughes, Violet Emma Hughes, Walter Hughes. Marriage certificates for Walter Bunnett and Clara Elizabeth Hughes, Frank Tinsley Wagstaffe and Ethel Ellen Hughes. Death certificate for George Hughes.

England and Wales Census 1871 RG10/4694, f102, p20.

England and Wales Census 1881 RG11/4664, f36, p13.

England and Wales Census 1891 RG12/3838, f20, p33.

England and Wales Census 1901 RG13/4353, f76, p41.

England and Wales Census 1911 RG14/27929, sch194.
